bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R.H. Brooke, June 17, 1941

div1.p: Hench thanks Brooke for locating the Walter Reed records and writes that he hopes to come to Washington in the fall.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to R.H. Brooke, June 17, 1941
div1.opener:
Y. F.
June 17, 1941
Mr. R. H. Brooke
Chief Clerk
Office of the Surgeon General
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Brooke:
div1.p:
I cannot tell you how much I appreciate your
kindness in looking up the matter referred to in the en-
closed copy of your letter.

It will be some time before I get to Washington.
I hope to be there in the Fall, and will appreciate it
greatly if you would help me locate the Walter Reed material.
I have already done much research on this and hope to con-
tinue it if I can.

I will write you a little while before I expect
to arrive so that I can make sure that you will be in Wash-
ington or will be able to designate someone else to help
me.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
